page.title: 11RELIGION/METHODISM-MIDDLETON
page.content: The religious needs of the community were originally met by the parish church at Overton.At one time there was evidence of the past existence of a Quaker cemetery.It seems likely there was a stong Quaker tradition in the area.It was the Primitive Methodists who gave the village its first place of worship.Before this,the areaÂ£s Methodists met for worship in their farm cottages. The trustees were from local families, largely farmers,and the connections of many of these families with the Chapel are still strong.The Chapel,the only church in the village,exerts a strong influence on the community.It is the only country chapel in the Morecambe Methodist Circuit;built in 1967 to replace a smaller building on a site which has since vanished.
